pr_title: [GEOT-6578] equalTo support for matchAction and postgis optimization

timeline.message: [GEOT-6578] equalTo function support for matchAction and postgis optmization to overlap for array ANY match

timeline.bodyText: I call these methods "toCollection( obj )" as they are format shifting rather than accessing content.
timeline.author: jodygarnett

timeline.bodyText:
I try and stay away from this kind of logic (assuming the value is useful as provided and making methods to cast). Would the following work?
final Collection<Object> collection1 = expression1.evaulate( feature, Collection.class )
final Collection<Object> collection2 = expression2.evaulate( feature, Collection.class )
timeline.author: jodygarnett

timeline.bodyText: I am not sure how well this would work with a primitive array like int[]
timeline.author: jodygarnett

timeline.bodyText:
Where is expression3 evacuated? That could be a dynamic expression rather than a constant ...
MatchAction matchAction = expression3.evaluate( feature, MatchAction.class)
timeline.author: jodygarnett

timeline.bodyText: getExpression(2).evaualte( feature, MatchAction.class ) should work (there should be a converter that can convert from a string to an enum as required).
timeline.author: jodygarnett

timeline.bodyText:
Yeah this function is far weaker than the filter, compare:

StaticGeometry.equalTo
IsEqualsTo

You could consider just calling the filter so we have consistent handling:
Filter equalsTo = ff.equalsTo( expression1, expression2);
return equalsTo.evaualte( feature );

It would be easier to maintain and a stronger implementation, and if you play your cards right it could handle the matchAction for you.
timeline.author: jodygarnett

timeline.message: [GEOT-6578] some cleanup, and tested support for array of primitives

timeline.author: jodygarnett

timeline.message: [GEOT-6578]: more simplification and additional test for property to array comparison
